alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 1:32AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Craig, northern Delaware and southern Ottawa Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 132 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated outflow from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Welch to near Narcissa to 6 miles southeast of Wyandotte. Movement was south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Vinita... Grove... Fairland... Afton... Welch... Bernice... Bluejacket... Wyandotte... Honey Creek State Park... Bernice State Park... Cleora... Narcissa... Dodge... Cayuga... Centrailia... Pyramid Corners... Centralia... Twin Bridges State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 285 and 307. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
